bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, Jefferson Randolph Kean, and Albert E. Truby, August 27, 1948

div1.p: Hench describes the photographs that were taken at the Reed memorial event at the International Congress on Tropical Medicine. He notes that Lawrence Reed and Truby were misidentified in one photo.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, Jefferson Randolph Kean, and Albert E. Truby, August 27, 1948
div1.opener:
August 27, 1948
General Walter Lawrence Reed
General Jefferson R. Kean
General Albert Truby
My dear Friends:
div1.p:
I assume that Doctor Sawyer or one of his assistants sent you
photographs taken at the International Congress in Washington. If not, I
think you will want to get some. They sent me three or four very nice ones
and a list of identification. The two nicest ones were numbered 1376-88
(a picture of all of us on the platform) and photo 1376-93 is a photograph
of Hanberry standing up with General Reed sitting next to him. Unfortunately,
in the identification list which was sent along, in both of these pictures
General Reed was identified as General Truby and vice versa. I have written
to Mr. Frank Standley, Office of Press Relations, Department of State,
calling his attention to this error.

On the data sent to me there is no price list. I imagine therefore,
that these can be obtained free.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
